hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via MiCA Regulatory Flow Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes in European trading hours, when EU-regulated exchange volumes drop >30% vs. 7-day average while US/Asian volumes remain stable, and BTC fails to hold $84k support, a transition to BEAR regime occurs within 36 hours with >68% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: MiCA implementation creates regional liquidity fragmentation. EU volume drying up while other regions hold suggests regulatory-driven capital withdrawal. Breaking key support in thin liquidity accelerates selling as stops trigger.
entry_conditions: Top 3 EU-regulated exchange volumes (BTC) down >30% vs 7-day average
US + Asian exchange volumes within ±15% of 7-day average
BTC price breaks below $84k with <1% recovery in 4 hours

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims and holds $85.5k for 6 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 65% of signals result in BEAR regime, OR EU volume recovers within 24 hours without regime change.
